tips.title: Brush Twice Daily
tips.description: Brush your teeth at least twice a day, preferably in the morning and before bedtime. Use a fluoride toothpaste and brush for at least two minutes each time.

tips.title: Floss Regularly
tips.description: Flossing removes plaque and food particles from between your teeth where your toothbrush can't reach. Make it a daily habit to prevent gum disease and cavities.

tips.title: Use Fluoride Toothpaste
tips.description: Fluoride helps strengthen tooth enamel and prevents tooth decay. Choose a toothpaste with fluoride approved by dental associations for optimal protection.

tips.title: Limit Sugary Foods
tips.description: Reduce consumption of sugary snacks and drinks. Sugar feeds harmful bacteria in your mouth, leading to acid production that erodes tooth enamel.

tips.title: Drink Plenty of Water
tips.description: Water helps wash away food particles and bacteria. It also promotes saliva production, which naturally protects your teeth by neutralizing acids.

tips.title: Replace Your Toothbrush
tips.description: Replace your toothbrush every three to four months, or sooner if the bristles are frayed. A worn toothbrush is less effective at cleaning your teeth.

tips.title: Regular Dental Checkups
tips.description: Visit your dentist every six months for professional cleanings and checkups. Early detection of dental issues can prevent more serious problems later.

tips.title: Avoid Tobacco Products
tips.description: Tobacco use increases the risk of gum disease, tooth loss, and oral cancer. Quitting tobacco significantly improves your oral and overall health.

tips.title: Use Mouthwash
tips.description: Antimicrobial mouthwash can help reduce plaque and prevent gingivitis. Use it as a supplement to brushing and flossing, not as a replacement.

tips.title: Protect Your Teeth
tips.description: Wear a mouthguard during sports activities to prevent dental injuries. Also avoid using your teeth as tools to open packages or bottles.
